messageBody:
Hi,


I got a problem testing JNI code for a Java Interface to a C program.

Right now I have JUnit tests in Java and a corresponding dummy library
in C. I abuse a filename argument to tell the dummy C part what to do:
return special values, simulate errors, etc. So I can test error
mapping from C return codes to Java exceptions as well as if data is
passed correctly.

What I dislike is that my tests are in fact splitted into the JUnit
test case part and the C dummy library part and I would prefer them to
be just JUnit tests.

I did not find anything useful on junit.org or Google or the list
archives.

Can anybody provide me a good link on JNI testing or has someone
experienced similar problems?
I think about calling back into Java from the dummy library, has
someone done this (for testing) before? Is there perhaps a JUnit
derivate for just this?


Thanks in advance,

Robert
